acceptanceCriteria.criterion: SessionManifest interface extended with four new optional fields: displayName, displayTimestamp, userSummary, messageCount
Smart timestamp adapts to age: Today=`2:30p`, Yesterday=`Yday 2:30p`, This Week=`Mon 2:30p`, Older=`Oct 5`
Summary priority: user message > workflow input summary > workflow name > agent title
Chat API populates userSummary (first user message, 35 char limit) when creating session
Chat API increments messageCount on each message exchange
Display name computed and cached in displayName field on session creation
DirectoryTree groups sessions by agent (collapsible groups, sorted newest first within group)
Tooltip on hover shows full timestamp, message count, status, full user message, and UUID
Legacy sessions without displayName fall back to UUID (graceful degradation)

doc.title: Epic 6 Technical Specification
doc.snippet:
UPDATED APPROACH (v0.3):
**Agent Grouping:** - Sessions grouped by agent.title in directory tree - Collapsible groups (default: expanded) - Sessions sorted newest first within each group - Natural mental model: users think "Alex conversation about X"
**Smart Timestamp Logic:** - Today: "2:30p" (5 chars) - Yesterday: "Yday 2:30p" (11 chars) - This Week: "Mon 2:30p" (10 chars) - Older: "Oct 5" (5-6 chars)
**Display Name Format:** - "{smartTimestamp} - {summary (35 char max)}" - 40% shorter than original format (42 chars vs 70 chars) - Stored in displayName field for performance

artifact.reason: Existing SessionManifest interface from Story 5.0. Story 6.3 extends this with 4 new optional fields: displayName, displayTimestamp, userSummary, messageCount. No schema duplication - pure extension pattern.
Existing session discovery function. Story 6.3 reuses this for loading manifests with new display name fields. No changes needed - already handles optional fields gracefully.
Chat API that needs to be modified to create session with displayName on first message. Must extract userSummary, call generateDisplayName(), save to manifest, and increment messageCount.
Directory tree component that needs agent grouping logic. Must group sessions by agent.title, implement collapsible groups, sort by newest first, and render displayName || UUID fallback.

node.package: React hooks for agent grouping UI

constraints.constraint: Extend existing SessionManifest from Story 5.0 - no new interfaces or duplicate schemas
Display name format: "{smartTimestamp} - {summary (35 char max)}" - must not exceed ~45 chars total
Smart timestamp logic must adapt to age: today (5 chars), yesterday (11 chars), this week (10 chars), older (5-6 chars)
Summary priority: user message > workflow input summary > workflow name > agent title (4 levels of fallback)
Agent grouping: sessions grouped by agent.title, collapsible, sorted newest first within group
Tooltip displays full details: timestamp, user, message count, status, full message, UUID
Backward compatible: legacy sessions without displayName fall back to UUID (no crashes)
Performance: displayName computed once and cached (not on every render)
Truncation: 35 character max for summaries with "..." ellipsis if longer
File-based architecture: all metadata stored in manifest.json (no database)

decision.title: Extend SessionManifest (Not Duplicate)
decision.context: Story 6.3 originally proposed new SessionMetadata interface with duplicate API endpoints. Story 5.0 already has manifest.json with SessionManifest.
decision.decision: Extend existing SessionManifest with 4 optional fields instead of creating new schema
decision.impact: Reduced from 9 tasks to 7 tasks, eliminated API endpoint duplication
decision.benefit: Single source of truth, backward compatible, reuses existing utilities

decision.title: Agent Grouping + Smart Timestamps
decision.context: Original format "Oct 7, 2:30 PM - {message}" was 70+ chars, hard to scan, no natural grouping
decision.decision: Group by agent + smart timestamps that adapt to age (today="2:30p", older="Oct 5")
decision.impact: 40% shorter names (42 chars vs 70 chars), natural mental model
decision.benefit: Compact, scannable, age-aware context without overwhelming detail

decision.title: Tooltip for Full Details
decision.context: Compact names lose context - need way to show full details
decision.decision: Keep names compact, show full details in tooltip on hover
decision.content: Full timestamp, user, message count, status, full message, UUID
decision.benefit: Best of both worlds - compact view with detailed inspection capability
